{"step_by_step_thinking": "Wandering and physically nonaggressive agitation are two different behaviors commonly seen in individuals with certain medical conditions, such as dementia. Wandering refers to the act of aimlessly moving around without a specific purpose or destination. On the other hand, physically nonaggressive agitation refers to restlessness, fidgeting, or pacing without any intention to harm others physically. While both behaviors may occur simultaneously in some individuals, they are not equivalent.
